Sure, I can provide you with a brief comparison of the syllabus for BAMS programs in Nepal and India.

BAMS (Bachelor of Ayurvedic Medicine and Surgery) is an undergraduate program that focuses on the study of Ayurveda, an ancient system of medicine. While there may be some variations in the syllabus for BAMS in Nepal and India, the basic subjects and topics covered are similar. Here are some of the key subjects covered in BAMS programs in Nepal and India:

1. Ayurvedic Philosophy: This subject covers the fundamental principles of Ayurveda, including the concept of Tridosha (Vata, Pitta, and Kapha), Prakriti (constitution), and the concept of health and disease.
2. Anatomy: This subject covers the study of the human body and its structures from an Ayurvedic perspective.
3. Physiology: This subject covers the functions of the various organs and systems of the body from an Ayurvedic perspective.
4. Pharmacology: This subject covers the study of Ayurvedic drugs and their therapeutic uses.
5. Pathology: This subject covers the study of the causes and effects of diseases from an Ayurvedic perspective.
6. Panchakarma: This subject covers the various detoxification and rejuvenation therapies used in Ayurveda.
7. Obstetrics and Gynecology: This subject covers the Ayurvedic approach to pregnancy, childbirth, and postpartum care.
8. Surgery: This subject covers the Ayurvedic surgical techniques used in the treatment of various diseases.

Overall, while there may be some differences in the syllabus for BAMS programs in Nepal and India, the core subjects and topics covered are similar, as both countries follow the ancient Indian system of Ayurvedic medicine.
